channel.title: teaching on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in teaching on Barefoot Rob

item.title: (teaching) today
item.description: 23:03 Wednesday 30 May 2018 JST On Wednesdays, I wake up at 5am and leave the house at 5:45am so I can get on a train that arrives in Noborito at 6:29am but leaves Noborito at 6:57am. That gives 58 minutes of sleeping time on the train including both waiting and riding to Kawasaki. Then lesson in Solid Square with Ayano, Takato, Yohei, Ai, and I talking about reasons we (dis)like certain months or seasons.

item.title: language day
item.description: ##10:55 Saturday 28 March 2015 JST## I’m at JB school now, ready to teach three lessons, then zip over to Toshiba and teach two lessons. Then from 7pm I’ll be at a Japanese study group in Akihabara.

item.title: Chapters
item.description: ##18:24 Tuesday 10 February 2015 JST## Today I had three more hours of lessons than I normally have on Tuesdays. In addition to Akabanebashi and Mutsumis, I taught at Toshiba near Kawasaki station. It worked out well because Lin took today off work and we got to chow lunch at Lazona after I finished at 2pm. After lunch, we smooched and I headed to Ebisu to chill with Nate for a bit.

item.title: First 赤羽橋 lesson
item.description: ##10:20 Tuesday 11 November 2014 JST## Today was my first lesson in 赤羽橋, a station whose kanji I cannot really read yet, though I know each kanji individually if I read slowly. The lesson is a beginner level lesson, though I think the article I brought was a bit too difficult for the level. I’ll bring an easier article next time. Only two students: A on the left wearing a necklace made by her friend ten years ago, and A on the right with all his mobile devices.
